componenttext: Our next question is from Juan Sanabria of Bank of America.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I just wanted to follow-up on Nick's question on the leverage at the SpinCo. Did you say, you're looking to raise about $2 billion of debt at SpinCo? Or I'm not sure if there was a material amount of potential other noncore dispositions that would get you
componenttext: I just wanted to follow-up on Nick's question on the leverage at the SpinCo. Did you say, you're looking to raise about $2 billion of debt at SpinCo? Or I'm not sure if there was a material amount of potential other noncore dispositions that would get you to that sum that you highlighted in your presentation as far as capital coming back to HCP.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: No, I did not say there would be $2 billion at SpinCo, that's the amount of capital in addition to the RIDEA we target to have HCP be at the right level. The amount of debt at SpinCo, we expect to be at about a 5x leverage ratio on market level rents at S
componenttext: No, I did not say there would be $2 billion at SpinCo, that's the amount of capital in addition to the RIDEA we target to have HCP be at the right level. The amount of debt at SpinCo, we expect to be at about a 5x leverage ratio on market level rents at SpinCo. And that's a number that we've validated through our advisers, that they feel is achievable in the marketplace just given the yield and risk reward.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And so that would be based on potentially a rent cut figure? And is that 5x a net debt-to-EBITDA number?
componenttext: And so that would be based on potentially a rent cut figure? And is that 5x a net debt-to-EBITDA number?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Yes, that would -- that's how we told they would underwrite it. It doesn't mean there's any change in the EBITDA, but that's how they would underwrite it.
componenttext: Yes. Yes, that would -- that's how we told they would underwrite it. It doesn't mean there's any change in the EBITDA, but that's how they would underwrite it.

componenttext: Okay. And then on G&A. So how much incremental G&A are the 2 entities post-spin? How much actual G&A are we talking -- how many dyssynergies?

componenttext: I would say it's immaterial and those details will come out when we do the Form 10.

componenttext: And how about for pro forma HCP, is G&A going to go down? I know you've added Kai and -- or are you net losing G&A in that you're presumably going to have some headcount go with SpinCo? How should we think about pro forma HCP where the details won't be in the Form 10?

componenttext: There will be services that we will contract SpinCo out of HCP. But I think it's premature to have much more than that at this time. Again, we think it's not material and we expect sort of this similar run rate ratio.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And just a big strategic question. Was there a contemplation to do a strategic review of HCP as a whole, not just ManorCare?
componenttext: And just a big strategic question. Was there a contemplation to do a strategic review of HCP as a whole, not just ManorCare?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Mike McKee again. Over the last 3 or 4 months, we told you on the last earning call that we were going to look at all of our options. And we have run a process that has done that. We've had a number of meetings at the board level, many more at the
componenttext: This is Mike McKee again. Over the last 3 or 4 months, we told you on the last earning call that we were going to look at all of our options. And we have run a process that has done that. We've had a number of meetings at the board level, many more at the management team level. We've been advised by some very experienced financial and legal advisers. And we went through a comprehensive process and looked at all of our alternatives. A number of those alternatives remain open with SpinCo. And as we've tried to emphasize today, we think that, that vehicle is a much more flexible vehicle to open up a full menu of options that aren't as easily accommodated at HCP. So we look forward to executing the spin and then having Mark Ordan and his team continue to keep open avenues that go after that value. So I can assure you that there have been hundreds of hours of analysis, discussion, pros and cons. Obviously, some of that stays in the boardroom. But I can certainly assure you it's been quite comprehensive.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And just a last quick question for me. What's the pro forma exposure to Brookdale of HCP? And could you just remind us of, I think you talked about a second leg of Brookdale dispositions, and what the quantum there is, and views on valuation for tho
componenttext: Okay. And just a last quick question for me. What's the pro forma exposure to Brookdale of HCP? And could you just remind us of, I think you talked about a second leg of Brookdale dispositions, and what the quantum there is, and views on valuation for those assets?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure, this is Justin. Post-spin, the concentration would be about 1/3. And we were -- I should mention that, that we find it to be a double-edged sword to some degree, because we think Brookdale is on solid footing, new management, fresh approach. Certain
componenttext: Sure, this is Justin. Post-spin, the concentration would be about 1/3. And we were -- I should mention that, that we find it to be a double-edged sword to some degree, because we think Brookdale is on solid footing, new management, fresh approach. Certainly, our operating portfolio has seen really good results, but we're mindful of concentrations and capital recycling. So the RIDEA II transaction I mentioned presented an opportunity for us. Meanwhile, we're in regular discussions with Brookdale in terms of how to unlock value within our triple-net portfolio. I mentioned 25 assets. The valuation relative to those assets hasn't really been determined. I can tell you, our intention is to either sell assets or in the event that those noncore assets for Brookdale are, in fact, a core asset for a regional operator, we may place those with a new operator. The intent is to be cash flow neutral. There'll be a little bit of pick-up due to some of the performance of the assets. And so we're actually expecting a slight improvement in our cash flow coverage about 1.5x as a result of the transaction. But a lot of the details are still being discussed and we'll have more down the road as that materializes.

componenttext: This is Justin. There is ranges we've actually spoken to in the past, and you can get as tight as about maybe blended to a 1 3 [ph] over an 8 [ph] And depending on the specific asset, you may go a little higher coverage, higher yield in certain markets and certain higher-quality assets you might be on the lower end of that number.

componenttext: Remember that SpinCo will have both the post-acute skilled assets, which ManorCare is in the marketplace known as having very high-quality real estate as well as the Arden Court memory care, which is the private pay senior housing assets.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Kevin Tyler of Green Street Advisers.
componenttext: Our next question is from Kevin Tyler of Green Street Advisers.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Mike, just a quick follow-up on Ross' question. Post-spin, do you plan to move to a less active role? Or are you planning to be involved in the day-to-day activities for the longer term at this point?
componenttext: Mike, just a quick follow-up on Ross' question. Post-spin, do you plan to move to a less active role? Or are you planning to be involved in the day-to-day activities for the longer term at this point?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I'm signed up for -- my longer term might not be your longer term. But it's not a short-term assignment, let me put it that way. I think that we've got -- we're very excited after a couple of years of almost an obsession with HCR ManorCare to get in
componenttext: Well, I'm signed up for -- my longer term might not be your longer term. But it's not a short-term assignment, let me put it that way. I think that we've got -- we're very excited after a couple of years of almost an obsession with HCR ManorCare to get into back to the growth profile we're used to over our 30-plus years. So we don't really have a time horizon. I'm not going to be day-to-day managing the company, that's Lauralee and the team's job. But I am going to be active in my role focused on, in the near-term, certainly helping Mark Ordan and the team execute SpinCo, but we've got a lot of other things to do, and so I'm sure they'll keep me relatively busy.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then in the deck, you mentioned a wide range of strategies available to be pursued by SpinCo. Can you just elaborate a little further on those? And then maybe how quickly we should expect them to play out? And is there a range of expectations? W
componenttext: Okay. And then in the deck, you mentioned a wide range of strategies available to be pursued by SpinCo. Can you just elaborate a little further on those? And then maybe how quickly we should expect them to play out? And is there a range of expectations? We mentioned the rent cut. Is there a range of expectations that's been discussed? How should we think about quantifying that? And then lastly on the ManorCare piece, is there any update as it relates to the DOJ?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Let me take the last one because it's real quick. No change, really nothing to update you on. I think it's early to discuss what's going to happen at SpinCo. What we have done is give SpinCo all the tools to optimize what they can do. I don't think we nee
componenttext: Let me take the last one because it's real quick. No change, really nothing to update you on. I think it's early to discuss what's going to happen at SpinCo. What we have done is give SpinCo all the tools to optimize what they can do. I don't think we need to remind you that a REIT is limited to ownership of less than 10%. We've done certain things in terms of the structure that SpinCo can do in terms of positioning the assets on their valuation. So the structure spin really does not foreclose out any options. It's just way too early to have that play through.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I also think there's a recognition that absent some divine intervention, this is a process that's likely to take some time. And it's not just related to HCR ManorCare, but the whole space of post-acute and SNFs, as you well know, is in a challenged period
componenttext: I also think there's a recognition that absent some divine intervention, this is a process that's likely to take some time. And it's not just related to HCR ManorCare, but the whole space of post-acute and SNFs, as you well know, is in a challenged period of time. As we said in our prepared remarks, we think that, over the long term, this is a necessary area, one that the government will support and one that will be even more important long term in the continuum of care as there's an emphasis of moving patients who can't go home out of hospitals and into this kind of care. But right now, the issues facing the industry are complex and many. And we can't predict at this time how long it will take for the industry to stabilize. And we have been rather patient at HCP, in my opinion, about trying to see if there is some recovery on the horizon. But right now, we can't predict when that is. So one of the motivations in moving to the spin was the recognition that if you can't predict that and you have an overhang on the 75% of the business, which we think is pretty terrific, the spin just makes a lot of sense to us, to not only to give more flexibility around options, but also to recognize this is likely to take some time.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just one last one and kind of a nitpicker on the deck. But you mentioned that HCP could provide seller financing at market terms for a limited period of time to the SpinCo. I guess I was just wondering, is there an order of magnitude that,
componenttext: Okay. And then just one last one and kind of a nitpicker on the deck. But you mentioned that HCP could provide seller financing at market terms for a limited period of time to the SpinCo. I guess I was just wondering, is there an order of magnitude that, that could go up to? Is it free rein? Or how are you thinking about that part of the potential arrangement?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, overall, we're going to keep the leverage and the balance sheet at SpinCo conservative, so don't assume there's going to be a significant amount of debt placed on us in seller financing. Also, if we do provide seller financing, it's because we think
componenttext: Well, overall, we're going to keep the leverage and the balance sheet at SpinCo conservative, so don't assume there's going to be a significant amount of debt placed on us in seller financing. Also, if we do provide seller financing, it's because we think it is the right thing for HCP prime to do so. And that it would be a good interim investment for us as this plays through. So again, that's still to be determined, flexibility around it, but all of the financing structures at both HCP and SpinCo are to have balance sheets that support the investment thesis of both companies.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Chad Vanacore, Stifel.
componenttext: Our next question is from Chad Vanacore, Stifel.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So just thinking about the SpinCo or ManorCare, are there any expected changes to ManorCare lease terms, post-spin, that could be on maturities, rents, escalators or any other material items?
componenttext: So just thinking about the SpinCo or ManorCare, are there any expected changes to ManorCare lease terms, post-spin, that could be on maturities, rents, escalators or any other material items?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: We're not -- that will really be a determination of Spin. We're not anticipating anything at this time.
componenttext: We're not -- that will really be a determination of Spin. We're not anticipating anything at this time.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then, I mean, do you expect any changes to rent or rent coverage on that portfolio pro forma for the spin in dispositions? I know right now, you say that you're expecting rent coverage to be 1.06x to 1.16x.
componenttext: Okay. And then, I mean, do you expect any changes to rent or rent coverage on that portfolio pro forma for the spin in dispositions? I know right now, you say that you're expecting rent coverage to be 1.06x to 1.16x.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Spin is going to have its own management team, its own board. They're going to be laser-focused on, at the outset, being the landlord here. I think that, with due respect, SpinCo won't probably be in existence for a few months now, and they'll have to res
componenttext: Spin is going to have its own management team, its own board. They're going to be laser-focused on, at the outset, being the landlord here. I think that, with due respect, SpinCo won't probably be in existence for a few months now, and they'll have to respond to facts on the ground. We don't know, and it's hard to predict what's happening. And it's very dynamic. So I think it wouldn't be helpful, frankly, to try to look out a little bit and wonder what happened. We know what's happened in the last quarter or 2. We know that they've basically -- as Lauralee said a little bit ago, they've -- they're moving forward, and we assume that will continue. But we're not in a position, as landlord, to really have visibility of that. So I think it's hard to predict.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: All right. And implied by the statement that you'd levered up commensurate with what the market would bear. What would you estimate the difference between current rents and market level rents are right now?
componenttext: All right. And implied by the statement that you'd levered up commensurate with what the market would bear. What would you estimate the difference between current rents and market level rents are right now?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think Justin addressed it when he talked about coverage. So I think that would really be the math, and you can do it your own way. But market generally looks at coverage levels. And I think that's the way the underwriters still look at it when they put
componenttext: I think Justin addressed it when he talked about coverage. So I think that would really be the math, and you can do it your own way. But market generally looks at coverage levels. And I think that's the way the underwriters still look at it when they put their debt on it.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: All right. But Lauralee, right now, I mean, we're looking at just a little over 1x rent coverage. Yes. And you say 5x what a market level rent would be, and that implies that market lever rents are below where they are now. Would that be appropriate to th
componenttext: All right. But Lauralee, right now, I mean, we're looking at just a little over 1x rent coverage. Yes. And you say 5x what a market level rent would be, and that implies that market lever rents are below where they are now. Would that be appropriate to think about?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: That is how the debt underwriters will underwrite it, that's correct.
componenttext: That is how the debt underwriters will underwrite it, that's correct.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then what does a contemplated capital structure look like for SpinCo? Is this a secured debt? Is it unsecured? Is it to be determined?
componenttext: Okay. And then what does a contemplated capital structure look like for SpinCo? Is this a secured debt? Is it unsecured? Is it to be determined?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's to be determined. But again, we would look for the best financing to make SpinCo and their investment thesis successful.
componenttext: It's to be determined. But again, we would look for the best financing to make SpinCo and their investment thesis successful.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: All right. And then you mentioned in the press release about tax implications. I know this quarter, it looks like you had $49 million of income tax associated with the gain on disposals. What kind of taxable event should we expect post-SpinCo?
componenttext: All right. And then you mentioned in the press release about tax implications. I know this quarter, it looks like you had $49 million of income tax associated with the gain on disposals. What kind of taxable event should we expect post-SpinCo?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Chad, that's -- the $53 million that we talked about, that's a potential tax liability. The actual amount will be dependent on how the transaction takes place. But from a federal perspective, we've cleared through a holding period, and the tax liability t
componenttext: Chad, that's -- the $53 million that we talked about, that's a potential tax liability. The actual amount will be dependent on how the transaction takes place. But from a federal perspective, we've cleared through a holding period, and the tax liability that's associated with the HCR ManorCare assets is really at a state level. But the ultimate exposure will be dependent on the transaction that gets executed, but it wouldn't be any larger than $49 million.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: All right. And then are there any updates on a ManorCare potential DOJ settlement?
componenttext: All right. And then are there any updates on a ManorCare potential DOJ settlement?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: No.
componenttext: No.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: All right. One last question from me. What do you think the market is not getting right about this ManorCare portfolio as part of HCP that it will be -- that you think will be recognized as stand-alone entity?
componenttext: All right. One last question from me. What do you think the market is not getting right about this ManorCare portfolio as part of HCP that it will be -- that you think will be recognized as stand-alone entity?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, that's really, I think, an interesting question. We think SpinCo is going to be a very interesting company actually. Often, spins are motivated by a desire to separate off assets that are a drag on the overall business. And certainly, that's the cas
componenttext: Well, that's really, I think, an interesting question. We think SpinCo is going to be a very interesting company actually. Often, spins are motivated by a desire to separate off assets that are a drag on the overall business. And certainly, that's the case here. But having said that, as mentioned earlier, many still consider HCR ManorCare as a leader in this space based on their quality of care and clinical capabilities and the quality of the real estate. So there's a lot for Mark Ordan to work with here. And we believe in a dedicated vehicle, he'll be able to better translate to the market the potential in the platform. There's been a lot of focus on it, not just through us, but more generally, in the space. But we think the dedicated vehicle will allow more transparency to the extent we have it. Again, as a landlord, you're somewhat limited, you're not the operator. But nevertheless, we think that with his background in health care, in real estate, as CEO of several spins or turnarounds and a successful track record, that he's uniquely positioned to both translate to the market but also find the path of different alternatives that unlocks the most value.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I might add one thing to that in terms of value at HCP. I think one of the things that's very difficult for the marketplace to look at is it's really the value of the 75% of our business. Because while that is an overhang, it means that we don't have the
componenttext: I might add one thing to that in terms of value at HCP. I think one of the things that's very difficult for the marketplace to look at is it's really the value of the 75% of our business. Because while that is an overhang, it means that we don't have the growth dynamics that we would have if -- with a cleaner cost of capital and a clearer vision by the marketplace of what we can do with that portfolio. So there's a way to optimize the SpinCo, but it gives a very clear path of what HCP is and the potential of the portfolio, the growth dynamics and what the management team can do with that.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Michael Carroll of RBC.
componenttext: Our next question is from Michael Carroll of RBC.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Can you guys talk a little bit about the sequential improvement that HCR ManorCare was able to achieve? What drove the occupancy improvement? Is that sustainable?
componenttext: Can you guys talk a little bit about the sequential improvement that HCR ManorCare was able to achieve? What drove the occupancy improvement? Is that sustainable?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: There was a seasonally higher census improvement. They were coming off of a particularly bad Q4, so it actually had about a 20% increase, up about $21 million in Q1. Flu season was soft, but it was also a little late this year. So performance is relativel
componenttext: There was a seasonally higher census improvement. They were coming off of a particularly bad Q4, so it actually had about a 20% increase, up about $21 million in Q1. Flu season was soft, but it was also a little late this year. So performance is relatively stable.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then can you kind of describe why fourth quarter was so weak? And is it possible for, I guess, the second half performance that we saw in 2015 to reoccur in the future?
componenttext: And then can you kind of describe why fourth quarter was so weak? And is it possible for, I guess, the second half performance that we saw in 2015 to reoccur in the future?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is a business that's clearly seasonal. And quite frankly, we were surprised by Q4, because typically, the fourth quarter in skilled nursing industry is strong. We would have expected it to lift over Q3. It didn't happen. We're pleased to see the Q1 p
componenttext: This is a business that's clearly seasonal. And quite frankly, we were surprised by Q4, because typically, the fourth quarter in skilled nursing industry is strong. We would have expected it to lift over Q3. It didn't happen. We're pleased to see the Q1 performance. There is usually a softness in the summer months, and then it picks up again in the later part of the year. We can't predict that now. Certainly, had a little surprise even in second half of last year, but thus far, things look stable.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And then Lauralee, can you talk a little bit about HCP's new leverage goals? I think you target 6.5x. Is that 6.5x just until the spin occurs and then you want to get back closer to HCP's longer-term goals that they have set? Or do you plan o
componenttext: Okay, great. And then Lauralee, can you talk a little bit about HCP's new leverage goals? I think you target 6.5x. Is that 6.5x just until the spin occurs and then you want to get back closer to HCP's longer-term goals that they have set? Or do you plan on with running a little bit higher leverage?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: No, our long-term goal is to get down to the 6x. What we have in the 6.5x is that we see a very defined plan that we can guide you to, both with proceeds from Spin and with asset sales and relatively frictionless payoff of high-coupon debt. And so that ge
componenttext: No, our long-term goal is to get down to the 6x. What we have in the 6.5x is that we see a very defined plan that we can guide you to, both with proceeds from Spin and with asset sales and relatively frictionless payoff of high-coupon debt. And so that gets us to the 6.5x, but our long-term goal is to get down to 6x, if not below.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, great. And sorry if I missed this earlier, but did you guys mention why the same-store forecast for the triple-net senior housing portfolio has dropped? I mean, are you expecting amendments there? Or is this really -- it's the sales?
componenttext: Okay, great. And sorry if I missed this earlier, but did you guys mention why the same-store forecast for the triple-net senior housing portfolio has dropped? I mean, are you expecting amendments there? Or is this really -- it's the sales?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: In the same-store, there is a rent cut that was given -- that was associated with the transaction we did a couple of years ago with Brookdale where they extinguished the purchase option. So it was about a $7 million hit to our triple-net income due to tha
componenttext: In the same-store, there is a rent cut that was given -- that was associated with the transaction we did a couple of years ago with Brookdale where they extinguished the purchase option. So it was about a $7 million hit to our triple-net income due to that rent cut.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And that wasn't contemplated in the guidance that was given in the fourth quarter?
componenttext: And that wasn't contemplated in the guidance that was given in the fourth quarter?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I think you're referencing the slight downtick, Mike. It's actually a little weaker performance in the first quarter from Sunrise.
componenttext: Yes, I think you're referencing the slight downtick, Mike. It's actually a little weaker performance in the first quarter from Sunrise.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, but it looks like the RIDEA growth was picked up higher. Is there a change to the triple-net leases then?
componenttext: Okay, but it looks like the RIDEA growth was picked up higher. Is there a change to the triple-net leases then?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Let me just address the RIDEA part. Absolutely, performance was solid there, same-store was up about 9%, and then the overall portfolio had really strong double-digit growth over prior quarter sequentially. So we feel great about the operating portfolio p
componenttext: Let me just address the RIDEA part. Absolutely, performance was solid there, same-store was up about 9%, and then the overall portfolio had really strong double-digit growth over prior quarter sequentially. So we feel great about the operating portfolio performance. We have not adjusted any guidance relative to our RIDEA operating portfolio at this time. It's early in the year, as I mentioned, skilled nursing is seasonal, so is senior housing. So we want to see the year play out a little bit more, and then we'll consider making adjustments to our expectations in terms of our operating portfolio growth. However, at this point in time, it looks like we come out towards the top end of our range in terms of expectations there.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Andrew Rosivach of Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: Our next question is from Andrew Rosivach of Goldman Sachs.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'm curious, I'm guessing, as part of this process, you've seen the performance of previously -- previous spins. And if you own HCP now, you also own SpinCo. And CCP has had a tough run. WPG, where Mr. Ordan worked, had a tough run as well. What are kind
componenttext: I'm curious, I'm guessing, as part of this process, you've seen the performance of previously -- previous spins. And if you own HCP now, you also own SpinCo. And CCP has had a tough run. WPG, where Mr. Ordan worked, had a tough run as well. What are kind of the lessons learned and why do you think the spin can do better?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Mike McKee. We've at a lot of spins. Some have done well, some not so well. You've referenced a couple. I guess what I would focus on here is that a number of spins are spinning off assets that are not well received in the marketplace, really, for
componenttext: This is Mike McKee. We've at a lot of spins. Some have done well, some not so well. You've referenced a couple. I guess what I would focus on here is that a number of spins are spinning off assets that are not well received in the marketplace, really, for reasons that aren't related to some of the reasons that we're dealing with post-acute and SNF here. In one case, it was B malls. And in other case, it might be lesser quality facilities. We really are dealing here with an industry leader, and you can talk about the industry being in some stress. But I don't think anybody would say that this is bad real estate or that, that kind of quality of care that's going on here isn't top quality. So there's a lot to work with here. It is -- in its purest form, it is a workout-type of situation. But I would say that in some of the brainstorming we've done, there are lots of options out in the marketplace, because the whole space is in transition and trying to cope with many of the same problems. So we think that there's a wide array of strategies that could be considered once it's in a dedicated vehicle. So I think the basic answer, in my prior life, we had an open-end fund that was consistently in the third quartile on performance. We did a look, and we were way overweighted to suburban office for historical reasons. We completely flipped that and got out of it and now have top performance, top quartile performance. I think when Simon did their spin, they were looking at the B malls. B malls are in a tough space right now. So I don't think you can kind of correlate one asset class to another. I think you've got to look at the dynamics of each one on their merits. And I think we believe that there's a lot to work with here.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: No, I hear you. I just feel like this is like SNFs are becoming kind of analogous to being the B malls of health care, if you will. You guys have done a spin. Ventas has done a spin. Just to take the analogy, did you explore at all if there was a private
componenttext: No, I hear you. I just feel like this is like SNFs are becoming kind of analogous to being the B malls of health care, if you will. You guys have done a spin. Ventas has done a spin. Just to take the analogy, did you explore at all if there was a private market that was willing to own these assets? And are you doing a spin as a result of being unable to execute a sale?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, first, I'd say that the demographics of health care and post-acute is a lot different than B malls, so I'd just point that out. In terms of sales, there's a number of overhangs here that are temporary to a degree. DOJ was -- is one of them. So I thi
componenttext: Well, first, I'd say that the demographics of health care and post-acute is a lot different than B malls, so I'd just point that out. In terms of sales, there's a number of overhangs here that are temporary to a degree. DOJ was -- is one of them. So I think in terms of sales, you have to look at the inherent value, and it's a matter of timing. We've already been in the market with 50 properties. I think we've got 37 or 38 that have been sold. So we're pretty well aware of pricing and what's available out there. And anything that will be done on -- if -- in terms of more asset sales, will have to be done over time. It's not going to -- a number of people in the market have looked to us, and we agree with the advice that we need to do something pretty specific. And today, we're announcing something pretty specific. But as I said earlier, it's going to take time on a number of fronts to kind of work with this portfolio and maximize its value. So that's the rationale for putting it in a dedicated vehicle.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And really, I speed around [ph], I think all of us are trying to like do the quarter and spin at the same time. It looked like your interest income dropped a lot quarter-to-quarter, specifically on the senior housing investment. What was that?
componenttext: And really, I speed around [ph], I think all of us are trying to like do the quarter and spin at the same time. It looked like your interest income dropped a lot quarter-to-quarter, specifically on the senior housing investment. What was that?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: On a quarter-over-quarter basis, Andrew, we had some onetime gains last year relative to our senior housing development loan program. And that didn't replicate itself this quarter, so that's really what the flux is.
componenttext: On a quarter-over-quarter basis, Andrew, we had some onetime gains last year relative to our senior housing development loan program. And that didn't replicate itself this quarter, so that's really what the flux is.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Tayo Okusanya of Jefferies.
componenttext: Our next question is from Tayo Okusanya of Jefferies.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: First of all, I just want to say congratulations to Tim. You definitely will be missed. And then question-wise, I think I just wanted to go back to the question of, and it's been asked 1 or 2 times, and I feel like we've dancing around it a little bit. Th
componenttext: First of all, I just want to say congratulations to Tim. You definitely will be missed. And then question-wise, I think I just wanted to go back to the question of, and it's been asked 1 or 2 times, and I feel like we've dancing around it a little bit. This idea of -- with ManorCare, what exactly, as an independent REIT or SpinCo, what would SpinCo be able to do that could not be done under HCP? Just kind of to an extent HCP provided diversification, HCP provided a lower cost of capital, what can SpinCo really do to maximize shareholder value that just could not be done under the HCP platform?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, if we think about the investment thesis saying that this is an entity that is able to respond to and weather the changes in the industry coming from reimbursement, what we've done is not only put the assets in a capital structure that will be conser
componenttext: Well, if we think about the investment thesis saying that this is an entity that is able to respond to and weather the changes in the industry coming from reimbursement, what we've done is not only put the assets in a capital structure that will be conservative, that it can work with that, but if we think about the limitations of the REIT, we can only own 10%. We're putting our 10% ownership into SpinCo. We're also putting our DRO into SpinCo, which the marketplace has not valued, yet it has a great deal of value when you think about trades and so forth into the operating company. And with the flexibility that it can do different things, as it thinks about what it wants to do with the lease in place to make trades or not and optimize what it has. And we've also given it a capability to have a basis in the assets, which we did not have before, that it can do more things with the assets in terms of selling them, et cetera. So there's just a lot of tools. But in HCP, our shareholders expect consistency. And that's very hard to deliver when there's an unknown expectation. The investment thesis of SpinCo is you might expect some unexpected, but if those things happen, it's probably because value was created. So it's just a different investment thesis. It's better optimized outside of HCP. And that's what we feel we need to do for shareholders.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: But along those lines, if SpinCo is going to be a REIT, I would think, again, the average REIT shareholder wants stability of cash flow. That's why REITs -- the REIT that can generate consistent earnings is the one that trade at a higher multiple. Like wh
componenttext: But along those lines, if SpinCo is going to be a REIT, I would think, again, the average REIT shareholder wants stability of cash flow. That's why REITs -- the REIT that can generate consistent earnings is the one that trade at a higher multiple. Like why would I want to own SpinCo if there's going to be all this uncertainty and all this variability right off the bat? Like I'm just a little confused about the value I get from SpinCo as an investor.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I think that, again -- I'll add a little, but Lauralee hit on it, as a REIT and as a diversified REIT, as with the kind of credit rating and so forth that we have, there's -- we are generally a passive investor. We cannot own more than 9.9% of the e
componenttext: Well, I think that, again -- I'll add a little, but Lauralee hit on it, as a REIT and as a diversified REIT, as with the kind of credit rating and so forth that we have, there's -- we are generally a passive investor. We cannot own more than 9.9% of the equity. If some of these facilities, down the road, need to be operated, we can't be an operator. There are a number of things that might occur. We don't know which path we will ultimately go down. But SpinCo can, and it was referred to earlier, it's -- we will set it up as a REIT. It will be a REIT. It doesn't have to stay a REIT. HCP is going to be a REIT, period, end of paragraph. So when you start to kind of go down the options that we -- I told you we spent a lot of time thinking about numerous options. A number of them were foreclosed because of the vehicle HCP that the assets are held in. SpinCo won't be so restricted.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'll just add that in terms of the variability, when we did the valuation last quarter and established the new carrying value of the assets, to a market level lease rate and coverage, there was a reduction in our carrying value. In the case of Spin, I wou
componenttext: I'll just add that in terms of the variability, when we did the valuation last quarter and established the new carrying value of the assets, to a market level lease rate and coverage, there was a reduction in our carrying value. In the case of Spin, I would expect that they're probably going to likely start out -- market will give them what they think the value is. It was an impairment on our side. In their case, it'll be just the reality from the start.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'd say one other thing. We're really -- SpinCo is very interesting to us. We're excited about Mark Ordan and what he can bring to that vehicle. But as we said earlier, and I don't think we should move away from it, this is about HCP. When you look at wha
componenttext: I'd say one other thing. We're really -- SpinCo is very interesting to us. We're excited about Mark Ordan and what he can bring to that vehicle. But as we said earlier, and I don't think we should move away from it, this is about HCP. When you look at what Simon did, for example, people say, "Well, that spin was lackluster for -- after a while," but it did a hell of a lot for Simon properties. So we expect that HCP is going to have a very strong growth profile. And some of the relationships we have that we want to exploit are going to be at our front door now. So I think although we're spending a lot of time and should today about SpinCo, we need to really be excited about what's going to happen with HCP.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, fair enough. Is this a tax-free spinoff to HCP?
componenttext: Okay, fair enough. Is this a tax-free spinoff to HCP?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: No. This doesn't qualify as a tax-free under the codes, however -- I'm going to take it in 2 pieces. For our shareholders, effectively, the net effect is it will operate like a tax-free return of capital. And then equally important for HCP, we do not expe
componenttext: No. This doesn't qualify as a tax-free under the codes, however -- I'm going to take it in 2 pieces. For our shareholders, effectively, the net effect is it will operate like a tax-free return of capital. And then equally important for HCP, we do not expect that we will recognize any taxable income at the corporate REIT level. So net-net, this is an optimum structure.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it, okay. And then just one more, if you may indulge me. In the new guidance, you did maintain your cash same-store NOI, your RIDEA numbers for cash same-store NOI go up, but the numbers for the overall senior housing portfolio came down. Can you talk
componenttext: Got it, okay. And then just one more, if you may indulge me. In the new guidance, you did maintain your cash same-store NOI, your RIDEA numbers for cash same-store NOI go up, but the numbers for the overall senior housing portfolio came down. Can you talk a little bit about what you're expecting on the triple-net side then?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the triple-net came down for a couple of reasons. One is -- primarily, it's related to the rent cut that Brookdale received that was agreed to a couple of years ago as part of that transaction, where we extinguished the purchase options. It's about a
componenttext: Yes, the triple-net came down for a couple of reasons. One is -- primarily, it's related to the rent cut that Brookdale received that was agreed to a couple of years ago as part of that transaction, where we extinguished the purchase options. It's about a $7 million reduction. So that was an impact on the triple-net side. And then as you noted, we're off to a strong start on the operating portfolio.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Todd Stender of Wells Fargo.
componenttext: The next question is from Todd Stender of Wells Fargo.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'm not sure if I missed this, but what is the amount of the dividend that SpinCo will pay HCP? Has that been determined yet?
componenttext: I'm not sure if I missed this, but what is the amount of the dividend that SpinCo will pay HCP? Has that been determined yet?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: What we've talked about is that there will be debt proceeds raised at SpinCo that will come back to HCP, but that's not a dividend. Dividend policies will be set -- their dividend policy will be set by their board. But that'll be to their shareholders.
componenttext: What we've talked about is that there will be debt proceeds raised at SpinCo that will come back to HCP, but that's not a dividend. Dividend policies will be set -- their dividend policy will be set by their board. But that'll be to their shareholders.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: It'll be more of a distribution.
componenttext: It'll be more of a distribution.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right.
componenttext: Right.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. But the money back to HCP, is that not the case?
componenttext: Okay. But the money back to HCP, is that not the case?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's a distribution back to us.
componenttext: That's a distribution back to us.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: There will be a distribution back to HCP. I think the exact amount, we'll announce as we get closer to the spin because it depends on just market conditions at the time, so I don't think we should give you a number now. But that will come out as we get cl
componenttext: There will be a distribution back to HCP. I think the exact amount, we'll announce as we get closer to the spin because it depends on just market conditions at the time, so I don't think we should give you a number now. But that will come out as we get closer to the time of executing the spin.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And how about -- what about the 61 HCR ManorCare, the senior housing properties that are largely memory care? What happens to those?
componenttext: Okay. And how about -- what about the 61 HCR ManorCare, the senior housing properties that are largely memory care? What happens to those?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: They will be in the SpinCo at this time.
componenttext: They will be in the SpinCo at this time.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just, I guess, what happens to the HCP dividend rate on the common? You guys have had a long-standing history of being a dividend achiever. How does this transaction affect the current rate?
componenttext: Okay. And then just, I guess, what happens to the HCP dividend rate on the common? You guys have had a long-standing history of being a dividend achiever. How does this transaction affect the current rate?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Again, as I said earlier, our current dividend policy will stay in place until a spin is completed. And then post-spin, we will be looking at what is the right capital structure dividend, et cetera. But our focus is on total shareholder return. And that i
componenttext: Again, as I said earlier, our current dividend policy will stay in place until a spin is completed. And then post-spin, we will be looking at what is the right capital structure dividend, et cetera. But our focus is on total shareholder return. And that it's growth for our shareholders, which includes a dividend growth. So at this point in time, that dividend policy, that will be the policy, but a dividend has not yet been set.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just finally, just, Justin, you talked about the Brookdale concentration. It's certainly going to decline with the sale of the RIDEA portion. But you mentioned additional facilities you might either switch out the operator or sell. What doe
componenttext: Okay. And then just finally, just, Justin, you talked about the Brookdale concentration. It's certainly going to decline with the sale of the RIDEA portion. But you mentioned additional facilities you might either switch out the operator or sell. What does the Brookdale concentration ultimately go to? Wondering if you can talk about a target maybe.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I'm glad you asked that because I wanted to make another statement regarding the RIDEA II transaction. The beauty of it is that we remain an owner at all 49 assets. We like the relationship, we like the assets, we like the markets. And we're enjoying stro
componenttext: I'm glad you asked that because I wanted to make another statement regarding the RIDEA II transaction. The beauty of it is that we remain an owner at all 49 assets. We like the relationship, we like the assets, we like the markets. And we're enjoying strong performance over the past couple of quarters. And we'll continue to do so as an owner. We're just going to own less of it, and we're doing the transaction with a joint venture partner that we can grow with over time. And perhaps in time, we might be interested in buying the assets back. We wouldn't rule that out. So it was kind of a way to address concentration, address recycling, but still maintaining a relationship that we have a lot of confidence in. And that will be an ongoing dialogue we'll have with investors. Because as I said, we're probably going to be about down to 1/3 of our portfolio will be Brookdale post-spin. Certainly, to Mike's point and Lauralee's point, we will grow. Again, that's our intent, and that will help diversification. And I gave some examples earlier of some transactions that are bringing new operators to our company. We anticipate more of that. And then in regards to the triple-net discussions, there's been 25 noncore assets identified so far with Brookdale. There'll be more discussions with Brookdale. We have a great, very fluid dialogue with them, and we're in continuous and constant discussions about how to create value with that portfolio. So there may be ways to reduce even more concentration with the triple-net. But I think the overriding message here is that we like the relationship.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Jordan Sadler of KeyBanc Capital.
componenttext: The next question is from Jordan Sadler of KeyBanc Capital.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Jeff Gaston here for Jordan. So a few questions for you. You mentioned earlier that the spinoff plan targets mid-6x debt to EBITDA. Is that day 1 after the spinoff?
componenttext: This is Jeff Gaston here for Jordan. So a few questions for you. You mentioned earlier that the spinoff plan targets mid-6x debt to EBITDA. Is that day 1 after the spinoff?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: We've talked about 6.5x at HCP prime, our -- the main company. And again, what we have is a plan that with the spin proceeds coming back and the debt of the spin -- with the proceeds coming back to HCP, with the RIDEA sale that we just talked about and id
componenttext: We've talked about 6.5x at HCP prime, our -- the main company. And again, what we have is a plan that with the spin proceeds coming back and the debt of the spin -- with the proceeds coming back to HCP, with the RIDEA sale that we just talked about and identified asset sales in addition to that, that we would get to that 6.5x. So that is what we're definitely targeting as we move through the spin process and get that completed.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then -- so if you guys are going to be at 6.5x, what's your strategy for growth going to be? How do you plan on financing it post-spin?
componenttext: Okay. And then -- so if you guys are going to be at 6.5x, what's your strategy for growth going to be? How do you plan on financing it post-spin?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our financing plans are 60-40 as we look at new investments. We're very committed to being at a lower leverage, and we'll move to do that as soon as possible. But we think that we can be competitive at that level and be definitely a growth company in the
componenttext: Our financing plans are 60-40 as we look at new investments. We're very committed to being at a lower leverage, and we'll move to do that as soon as possible. But we think that we can be competitive at that level and be definitely a growth company in the marketplace.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then with the exit from the SNF portfolio, does that kind of -- does that kill your 5x5 strategy? Are you moving to a 5x4? How are you thinking about that longer term?
componenttext: And then with the exit from the SNF portfolio, does that kind of -- does that kill your 5x5 strategy? Are you moving to a 5x4? How are you thinking about that longer term?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we haven't had a 5x5 strategy for a while. But what we're very focused on is our 3 asset classes that are 95% private pay: our senior housing, our medical office portfolio and our life science. We think these are high-quality portfolios that give us
componenttext: Well, we haven't had a 5x5 strategy for a while. But what we're very focused on is our 3 asset classes that are 95% private pay: our senior housing, our medical office portfolio and our life science. We think these are high-quality portfolios that give us a lot of growth. We primarily focus on owning real estate in terms of structure. There is times when we do debt, but it's to get to the ownership of real estate. We think that's what REITs are supposed to do as an investment thesis. So our plan, which we laid out, I think, pretty clearly, both in the investor deck and hopefully in my comments that came through, that we're going to be in the premier part of the health care sector. And we think that offers significant opportunities for growth and returns for our shareholders.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then with the SpinCo being at roughly 5x leveraged, are you -- I guess, could you speak to whether you think it will be a growth vehicle? Or is it going to be focused primarily on being a workout vehicle?
componenttext: Okay. And then with the SpinCo being at roughly 5x leveraged, are you -- I guess, could you speak to whether you think it will be a growth vehicle? Or is it going to be focused primarily on being a workout vehicle?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I think I mentioned earlier, it's an interesting question. But I think the initial focus will be on the relationship with ManorCare and we'll be trying to move the assets -- not move them but work with ManorCare, if possible, to get to a good result
componenttext: Well, I think I mentioned earlier, it's an interesting question. But I think the initial focus will be on the relationship with ManorCare and we'll be trying to move the assets -- not move them but work with ManorCare, if possible, to get to a good result. And in that sense, there is a workout focus to it, because the initial focus is the fact that we don't think, respectfully, the market is crediting as much value as is there. And we need to try and find a way to unlock that, to use the word we've used quite a bit today. And that will be the primary focus from the get-go. I think we also said earlier that it's a space that is very dynamic at this point. So there may be other options to -- available to SpinCo, because it sits in a pretty interesting position within that space. But those are things that, really, Mark Ordan will be focused on. And I don't think he wants to enter this assignment with prejudgment about what is the optimal path forward.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just to clarify, earlier, I think Justin mentioned market level coverage was 1.3x. Was that EBITDAR or EBITDARM?
componenttext: Okay. And then just to clarify, earlier, I think Justin mentioned market level coverage was 1.3x. Was that EBITDAR or EBITDARM?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's EBITDAR.
componenttext: That's EBITDAR.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then a final question. Do you guys have a -- are you guys able to share what the current leverage at ManorCare is on a net debt-to-EBITDA basis?
componenttext: Okay. And then a final question. Do you guys have a -- are you guys able to share what the current leverage at ManorCare is on a net debt-to-EBITDA basis?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016

I mean, how should we think about the use -- first of all, is all that -- should we think of that being raised at the time of the spinoff, so all that capital be in, RIDEA II will done, the debt that will be placed, so you'll have that $2.75 billion? Or how should we think about that?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the plan is that we would accelerate prepayments. As I pointed out, that debt is a pretty high coupon, blended, it's a 6.4, but we got parts of it that are 6.7, 6.8. So it's a good optimum time to pay that off. And then beyond that, it would be deter
componenttext: Yes, the plan is that we would accelerate prepayments. As I pointed out, that debt is a pretty high coupon, blended, it's a 6.4, but we got parts of it that are 6.7, 6.8. So it's a good optimum time to pay that off. And then beyond that, it would be determined on what we do in terms of growth going forward, et cetera. So the goal is to be at a 6.5x leverage or less at the completion of the spin.

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016

componenttext: So Mike, just kind of a step back and I look at the big picture. Investors in HCP leverage goes up, at least for now. G&A as a percentage of revenue goes up. You probably have a dividend cut to normalize the situation. And then on SpinCo, you could convert it into a non-REIT, that's not good for REIT investors. You could have -- and probably will have another rent cut, and then you have the DOJ overhang. So a lot of unknowns, right, that are still out there. And while I appreciate you wanting to kind of get to this and resolve it and move forward in a decisive manner, did you give any thought to holding off and waiting 'til you had a little bit more information to share with investors so that they can make a little bit more of an educated decision on what to do in the here and now? Just curious, why did you decide to do this now when we don't have a whole lot of information?

headline: HCP, Inc., Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I think if you look at a number of spin transactions, what we're doing here in terms of timing of announcement is pretty standard. We've got a lot of work to do to execute. We wanted to get leadership in place. We wanted that known to the market. An
componenttext: Well, I think if you look at a number of spin transactions, what we're doing here in terms of timing of announcement is pretty standard. We've got a lot of work to do to execute. We wanted to get leadership in place. We wanted that known to the market. And if we felt that, as I said earlier, that within the next month or 2 or 3 that facts on the ground would change dramatically, we may have with a different store today. But we don't see that happening. So we felt that it was the best course to announce the direction. We think we've got the right plan, the right people in place that it opens up optionality. And more importantly, we think that it puts HCP on the right course to really be a very, very competitive force in this market. So we want to exploit some of those relationships that we've built. Where we've had some handcuffs on us, we take the handcuffs off. So that's why we're announcing this. And even though it'll take a little time, we're telling you a good bit about HCP, what -- how you evaluate SpinCo will happen over the next couple of months, and it will be iterative. But we thought it was really the right course to go ahead and announce it.
